newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Zaire orders ban on private TV station.
newsitem.headline: Zaire orders ban on private TV station.

text.p: Zaire ordered a popular private television station to shut down for three months for violating a ban on political broadcasts, the owner said on Wednesday.
But Ngongo Luwowo told Reuters his Tele Kin Malebo (TKM) channel would ignore what he called an illegal order, announced by a government facing a difficult rebel war.

"The notification says that on March 1st and 2nd, TKM broadcast news bulletins and press reviews, and that those are political programmes," said Ngongo, a member of parliament who supports veteran President Mobutu Sese Seko.

Information Minister Kolono Longo imposed restrictions on private TV and radio broadcasts last month, citing the war. Tutsi-led rebels took up arms against Mobutu's government last October and have taken over a vast stretch of eastern Zaire.
TKM broadcast its normal programmes on Wednesday.
"We will not inerrupt our transmission. The law does not bestow upon the minister the power to interdict political broadcasts," Ngongo said.
Some half a dozen private TV stations have sprung up in Zaire's sprawling capital Kinshasa in the past six years.
TKM, which is only six months old, is one of the most watched, building its audience on a diet of lively political debates featuring politicians of all tendencies.
